name: ZealousDateAndTime
description: Adds the time and date to the FPS label.

shortDayOfWeek.name: Abbreviated Day of Week
shortDayOfWeek.description:
Truncates the day of the week to its first three characters.

(Example: <cl>Sunday</c> -> <cl>Sun</c>)

dayFirst.name: Day First
dayFirst.description: Displays the day before the month.

shortMonth.name: Abbreviated Month Name
shortMonth.description:
Truncates the month name to its first three characters.

(Example: <cl>December</c> -> <cl>Dec</c>)

splitDateAndTime.name: Separate Date from Time
splitDateAndTime.description: Displays the date and time in separate lines.

twelveHour.name: 12 Hour Clock
twelveHour.description: Uses 12 hour clock instead of the 24 hour clock. <cy>Automatically includes AM/PM info.</c>

useUTC.name: Show UTC Offset Instead of Timezone Abbv.
useUTC.description:
<cl>Adapted from original code by Cvolton.</c>
Replaces your current timezone abbreviation with a (rough) estimate of your UTC offset.

<cy>This setting is not available on Windows; Windows users are only shown their UTC offset.</c>

uptime.name: Include Uptime
uptime.description: Display how long your game has been open.

blending.name: Readable Mode (Stronger Blending)
blending.description: If the date/time label uses <cl>this font you're seeing right now</c>, apply invert blending to make the date/time label easier to read against a wider variety of backgrounds.

hideEverywhereElse.name: Hide Outside Of Levels
hideEverywhereElse.description: Hides the date/time label outside of levels.

scale.name: Scale
scale.description: Change the size of the date/time label.

font.name: Font
font.description:
Choose the font that the date/time label will use.

<cj>0 for Pusab, -1 for Golden Pusab, and -2 for this</c> <cl>(default)</c> <cj>font you're reading right now.</c>
<cy>To use font numbers greater than 0: refer to the level editor for the font each number corresponds to, subtract that number by 1, and then put it here.</c>

zOrder.name: Z Order
zOrder.description: Choose the Z order of the date/time label. This is so you can better adjust things to avoid mod incompatibilities.
